p: In an applied One Health context, rabies diagnosis is the only routine procedure applied to a suspect animal that will directly determine the need for specific, life-saving medical intervention in a human at risk ( http://www.cdc.gov/rabies/pdf/rabiesdfaspv2.pdf). Laboratory diagnosis is critical to confirm the status of a suspect case, in part, to justify prophylaxis in exposed persons or animals, to measure objectively the impact of disease prevention programs, and to support certification of a country as free of disease.
